intro: Cereus speciosissimus var. bollwillerianus, commonly known as the Bollwiller candle, is a cactus native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its tall, cylindrical stem and clusters of white, night-blooming flowers. The plant is a succulent, adapted to arid environments with thick, fleshy stems that store water. It thrives in full sun and well-draining soil, requiring minimal water. Its striking appearance makes it a popular choice for both indoor and outdoor cultivation.
